etymologies: modern Latin, named after Johann E. Gunnerus (1718–73), Norwegian botanist

definitions: a South American plant that has extremely large leaves resembling rhubarb and that is grown as a waterside ornamental.

notes.text: Genus Gunnera, family Gunneraceae: several species, in particular G. manicata and G. tinctoria

shortDefinitions: South American plant with extremely large leaves that resemble rhubarb and which is grown as waterside ornamental
